intro: Callicoma serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated-leaved callicoma, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Callicoma serratifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained conditions.
